hero.title: Accelerating Climate Innovation
hero.description: We are Kenya's leading climate innovation center, empowering entrepreneurs to build sustainable solutions that drive green growth across Africa.

mission.description: To accelerate green growth by supporting climate entrepreneurs and innovative solutions that create lasting environmental impact.

approach.description: We provide comprehensive support including funding, mentorship, and market access to help climate innovations scale successfully.

impact.title: Our Impact
impact.description: Supporting 450+ SMEs, mobilizing $25M+ in investment, and creating 2,500+ jobs across the climate sector.

story.title: Building Africa's Climate Future
story.paragraph1: Founded as Kenya's premier climate innovation hub, KCIC has become the catalyst for transformative environmental solutions across East Africa. We believe that innovation is the key to addressing climate challenges while creating economic opportunities.
story.paragraph2: Our comprehensive ecosystem supports entrepreneurs at every stage, from early-stage ideation to market-ready solutions. Through strategic partnerships and targeted investments, we're building a sustainable future for Africa.

meta.title: Frequently Asked Questions - KCIC
meta.description: Find answers to frequently asked questions about KCIC programs, services, and how we support climate innovation in Kenya.

hero.title: Frequently Asked Questions
hero.subtitle: Get answers to common questions
hero.description: Find answers to frequently asked questions about KCIC programs, services, and how we support climate innovation in Kenya.

search.noResultsDescription: Try adjusting your search terms or category filter.

q1.question: What is the Kenya Climate Innovation Centre (KCIC)?
q1.answer: KCIC is a leading climate innovation hub that supports small and medium enterprises (SMEs) in developing and scaling climate solutions. We provide incubation, acceleration, funding access, and market linkages to drive sustainable development in Kenya and across Africa.

q2.question: When was KCIC established?
q2.answer: KCIC was established in 2010 with the vision of becoming the leading climate innovation centre in Africa. Over the past decade, we have supported 450+ SMEs and mobilized over $25M in investment.

q3.question: What is KCIC's mission?
q3.answer: Our mission is to accelerate climate innovation and green economic growth in Kenya by supporting climate-focused SMEs through incubation, acceleration, and access to finance, technology, and markets.

q1.question: What programs does KCIC offer?
q1.answer: We offer comprehensive programs including incubation for early-stage startups, acceleration for growing ventures, access to finance, market linkages, technical assistance, and capacity building across various climate sectors.

q2.question: What sectors does KCIC focus on?
q2.answer: We focus on key climate sectors including renewable energy, sustainable agriculture, water and sanitation, waste management, green transportation, energy efficiency, and climate adaptation technologies.

q3.question: How long are your incubation and acceleration programs?
q3.answer: Our incubation program typically runs for 6-12 months for early-stage ventures, while our acceleration program runs for 3-6 months for more mature startups ready to scale their operations.

q4.question: Do you provide funding to startups?
q4.answer: While KCIC doesn't directly provide funding, we facilitate access to finance through our network of investors, donors, and financial institutions. We also help startups prepare investment-ready business plans and connect them with appropriate funding sources.

q1.question: Who is eligible to apply for KCIC programs?
q1.answer: We support climate-focused SMEs at various stages of development. Eligibility criteria include having a climate solution with market potential, being legally registered or willing to register in Kenya, and demonstrating commitment to sustainable development goals.

q2.question: How do I apply for KCIC programs?
q2.answer: Applications can be submitted through our online portal. The process typically involves completing an application form, submitting a business plan, and participating in an evaluation process. We announce application periods through our website and social media channels.

q3.question: What documents do I need to apply?
q3.answer: Required documents typically include a detailed business plan, company registration documents, founder CVs, financial projections, proof of concept or prototype information, and any relevant certifications or permits.

q4.question: Is there an application fee?
q4.answer: No, there is no application fee for KCIC programs. Our services are provided free of charge to selected participants, thanks to support from our donors and partners.

q1.question: What support do startups receive?
q1.answer: Startups receive comprehensive support including business development training, technical assistance, mentorship, market linkages, access to finance facilitation, networking opportunities, and office space where available.

q2.question: How many companies has KCIC supported?
q2.answer: To date, KCIC has supported over 450 SMEs, mobilized more than $25M in investment, and contributed to the creation of over 2,500 green jobs across various climate sectors.

q3.question: Do you provide ongoing support after program completion?
q3.answer: Yes, we maintain relationships with our alumni companies and provide ongoing support through our network, follow-up services, and continued access to certain resources and opportunities.

q1.question: Who are KCIC's key partners?
q1.answer: Our partners include international donors like the World Bank, USAID, GIZ, and DFID; development partners like UNDP and Climate-KIC; government institutions; academic partners like Strathmore University; and private sector partners.

q2.question: How can organizations partner with KCIC?
q2.answer: Organizations can partner with us in various ways including funding support, technical expertise provision, market access facilitation, mentorship, and resource sharing. Contact us to discuss partnership opportunities that align with our mission.

q3.question: Do you work with international organizations?
q3.answer: Yes, we actively collaborate with international organizations, development agencies, and climate innovation networks to share knowledge, access global markets, and scale successful solutions beyond Kenya.

contact.title: Still have questions?
contact.description: Can't find the answer you're looking for? Our team is here to help.

meta.title: Who We Are - KCIC
meta.description: Learn about Kenya Climate Innovation Centre's mission, vision, values, and our journey to becoming Africa's leading climate innovation hub.

hero.title: Who we are
hero.subtitle: Empowering Climate Innovation in Kenya
hero.description: Kenya Climate Innovation Centre (KCIC) is a leading climate innovation hub fostering sustainable development through technology, entrepreneurship, and strategic partnerships.

mission.title: Our Mission
mission.description: To accelerate climate innovation and green economic growth in Kenya by supporting climate-focused small and medium enterprises (SMEs) through incubation, acceleration, and access to finance, technology, and markets.

vision.title: Our Vision
vision.description: To be the leading climate innovation centre in Africa, catalyzing sustainable development through transformative climate solutions and creating a thriving ecosystem for green entrepreneurship.

story.title: Our Story
story.paragraph1: Established in 2010, the Kenya Climate Innovation Centre (KCIC) was born from the recognition that Kenya's greatest climate challenges could become its greatest opportunities for innovation and economic growth.
story.paragraph2: Over the past decade, we have evolved from a pioneering initiative to a cornerstone of Kenya's climate innovation ecosystem. Through strategic partnerships with international donors, government institutions, and private sector leaders, we have created a comprehensive support system for climate entrepreneurs.
story.paragraph3: Today, KCIC stands as a testament to what's possible when innovation meets determination. With over 450 SMEs supported, $25M+ in investment mobilized, and 2,500+ green jobs created, we continue to drive Kenya's transition to a sustainable, climate-resilient future.

values.title: Our Values
values.subtitle: Our values guide every decision we make and every partnership we forge.

innovation.title: Innovation
innovation.description: We foster creativity and cutting-edge solutions to address climate challenges.

impact.title: Impact
impact.description: We measure success by the positive environmental and social change we create.

collaboration.title: Collaboration
collaboration.description: We believe in the power of partnerships to amplify our collective impact.

excellence.title: Excellence
excellence.description: We maintain the highest standards in everything we do.

sustainability.title: Sustainability
sustainability.description: We are committed to creating long-term, sustainable solutions.

transparency.title: Transparency
transparency.description: We operate with openness and accountability in all our activities.

achievements.title: Key Achievements
achievements.subtitle: Our impact speaks through the success of our partners and the communities we serve.

hero.title: Procurement
hero.subtitle: KCIC is committed to transparent, fair, and sustainable procurement practices that support our mission of climate innovation.

policy.title: Procurement Policy
policy.description1: Our procurement policy ensures transparency, accountability, and value for money in all our purchasing decisions. We prioritize suppliers who demonstrate commitment to environmental sustainability and social responsibility.
policy.description2: All procurement activities are conducted in accordance with international best practices and comply with relevant Kenyan laws and regulations.

principles.title: Key Principles
principles.compliance: Compliance with legal and regulatory requirements
